establishment.title: Background
establishment.summary: In the 1970s-1980s, Taiwan transitioned from import substitution to export orientation, with SMEs facing quality management challenges. The Ministry of Economic Affairs promoted the satellite factory system to address dispersed production issues
body: The 1970s-1980s marked Taiwan's crucial transition from import substitution to export orientation. Manufacturing flourished, but most SMEs remained family-run, small-scale, dispersed, and limited in technical capabilities.

As international orders increased and quality requirements rose, SMEs faced bottlenecks in stable supply, quality consistency, and delivery management. The Ministry of Economic Affairs observed that SMEs lacked systematic production and quality management of large enterprises, but their flexibility and low costs were key to Taiwan's industrial competitiveness.
Therefore, policy goals shifted to organizing SMEs into clustered production networks through the 'Satellite Factory System' to solve efficiency problems caused by dispersed production.

In 1984, the Ministry of Economic Affairs Industrial Development Bureau established the 'Center-Satellite Factory System Promotion Group' to promote the 'Center-Satellite Factory System', fostering collaborative production systems between large enterprises (center factories) and SMEs (satellite factories).
bullets: Introducing Japanese satellite factory experience and guidance techniques
Guiding domestic large enterprises to establish division of labor systems
Teaching SMEs to implement quality management (QC) and production management (TQC/TQM)
Establishing contract systems and cooperation mechanisms between center and satellite factories

establishment.title: Background
establishment.summary: Established in 2015 in response to cross-domain industry transformation needs and government policy direction, building a forward-looking smart service professional image
body: In 2011, Germany proposed 'Industry 4.0', triggering a global wave of manufacturing intelligence. Advanced countries successively launched development concepts for AI, IoT, cloud computing, and robotics technologies. The Taiwanese government also caught up with this trend, accelerating the integration of smart technologies into industrial systems. Against this background, CSDC established the 'Forward-looking Services Department' in 2015, with 'Smart Technology' as the core, promoting the upgrade and transformation of agricultural enterprises, food industry, healthcare, and commercial sectors, becoming an important milestone for CSDC's transition from manufacturing guidance to comprehensive industrial intelligence.
features: Cross-domain integration of industry value systems
Strategic partner for government and enterprises
